website_summaries.verdict: This old-style tool works well as a hammer but can also handle jobs requiring a hatchet.
pros: Hickory-handled ax has a nice weight and gives you a little bit more versatility than other hatchets
Handles small trees and kindling easily
cons: The blade on the hatchet side could be sharper coming out of the box

customer_reviews.title: This should make a great bushcraft camp axe
customer_reviews.text: This should make a great bushcraft camp axe. The hickory handle is high quality and perfectly hung. The palm swell in the middle is very comfortable and leaves enough room behind for two handed blows. Of course, you will need to sand the varnish off of the handle and the blade. I used 320 grit sand paper and then applied a protective coating of. The edge will need to be sharpened. I wish it could have been ordered with a sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Bushcrafter hatchet.
customer_reviews.text: Great bushcraft hatchet. It came dull as expected. I reprofiled it to a thick knife edge to suit its job. It can cut, split , carve and shave the hair off your arm. I made a sheath for it and a drop holster so I have somewhere to put it while I carry firewood. It cost me 24 bucks. Can't beat that. Even compared to my council tool velvicut boys axe and Hudson Bay axe @ over $135 a piece it still holds its own. Yes! You have to sharpen it yourself ! Get over it. Good job Vaughn!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Hammer for Heavy Framing
customer_reviews.text: I did not know at first the extent of this hammer for framing. Come to find out, it was the original primary framing hammer. Of course, people appear afraid because of the axe function of the tool. However, it is the most well-balanced hammer I've ever had. It is heavy enough to pound nails, and yet feels light enough with the right amount of balance. I love this hammer and thankful that it is still being produced. I will use this hammer as my primary hammer for framing.
customer_reviews.author: Digger

customer_reviews.title: Favorite hammer I own
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for years. Used it instead of my framing hammer most of the time until the axe side got too ground down. Got this now and I once again use it more than my expensive framing hammer
customer_reviews.author: Donovan M.

customer_reviews.title: Dull blade, but good ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: This is somewhere between an axe and a hatchet, which is exactly what I wanted for processing fire wood, and handling odd jobs for camping. The blade was disappointingly blunt out of the box, so you’ll have to use a dremel, file or grinding wheel to put an edge on it. Overall, happy with the design.
customer_reviews.author: SeanTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Assholes and elbows !!  Great tool !
customer_reviews.text: Back in the day these were are main hammer , carried a claw hammer for pulling nails. I've wore out a few of these . Set and drive all day long !
customer_reviews.author: Warcon

customer_reviews.title: Good tool, great value
customer_reviews.text: Nice tool, sturdily constructed, excellent, well-fitted handle. Factory edge is a little haphazard but a few minutes with a bastard file and a sharpening puck takes care of that in short order.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Andkilde

customer_reviews.title: Poor Grain Orientation
customer_reviews.text: If I hadn’t already bought another handle I’d be sending this back. This grain orientation is absolutely unacceptable, but it is a well designed tool and it can drive nails like nobody’s business.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: THIS SEEMS TO BE A VERY WELL MADE HATCHET
customer_reviews.text: THIS SEEMS TO BE A VERY WELL MADE HATCHET. I WON'T REALLY KNOW FOR SURE UNTIL I SHARPEN IT AND CHOP SOME FIREWOOD AND POUND SOME TENT STAKES. HOWEVER I SEE NO REASON NOT TO RECOMMEND ITS PURCHASE TO OTHERS. AND--WHATDEYA KNOW!! IT'S SOMETHING THAT'S ACTUALLY MADE IN THE U.S.A.!!
customer_reviews.author: BigEye in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for demo work.
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet cuts through wood lathe and horsehair plaster like its not even there. The heavy weight and solid construction instill confidence while performing demolition work. Every contractor should own one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. X

customer_reviews.title: Nice rigging axe
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, well balanced with a good feel in the hand rigging axe for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Great quality Great price
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what my stepson wanted this for but he absolutely loves it. Great quality and price. Made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie WV

customer_reviews.title: Yes!! Cut stuff
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet splits wood like a beast and has an American flag handle decal. All I ever wanted
customer_reviews.author: Rj

customer_reviews.title: Great versatility!
customer_reviews.text: Gift to my brother. He loves it for home and camp.
customer_reviews.author: NMW

customer_reviews.title: Chips is the handle
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got was awesome so i ordered another. This one came with chips in the handle by the axe head. Over all still sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: The best kindling maker
customer_reviews.text: This hatchet is excellent for making kindling. Send a half hour sharpening to make the perfect fireside kindling hatchet. Nice and long for strong hits, but comfortable to choke up on for more accurate delicate swings. It's easy to replace the handles on these and they're made in the USA. What more could you want?
customer_reviews.author: N B

customer_reviews.title: Great price, well made just needed a good sharpening ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price , well made just needed a good sharpening for a better edge
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get the steel handle instead.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent effort. First the positive: the head is well shaped, the hammer knurls are aggressive and seem to be long wearing. The steel seems to be high quality. The Bad: there's basically no balance to this tool. The strike with the blade is very offset and sinks decently but doesn't have enough oomph to cut through and is tough to extract. The Worst: while the handle is American hickory, the grain orientation shows no attention to detail in selection at all. After just 2.5 months of light use, the grains are already split apart. Take Away: Get the steel handle Vaughan, they're more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J Brown

customer_reviews.title: Rig axe review
customer_reviews.text: It's a fantastic tool. I've worn out a dozen of them over the years of framing. It's so well-balanced that it doesn't begin to feel like it's 28 ounce head weight
customer_reviews.author: Rick K.

customer_reviews.title: That said the Vaughn is a great rigging axe
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the Plumb whenever available. That said the Vaughn is a great rigging axe.!
customer_reviews.author: William J Prochaska

customer_reviews.title: Great carpenter hammer
customer_reviews.text: Great hatchet hammer. A bit on the heavy side but will be great to sink the larger nails. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Its an excellent hatchet and the handle was longer than i imagined ...
customer_reviews.text: Its an excellent hatchet and the handle was longer than i imagined so you can get alot of power out of it, the hammer head on the axe makes it a great multitool for any camp kit.
customer_reviews.author: jerrod romero

customer_reviews.title: Even better than older models
customer_reviews.text: Even better than older models. Nice to see an American company improving upon an already good design instead of cutting cost. Well made tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just needed to be sharpened up and good to go
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have useing a rigging ax for framing more then 21 years
customer_reviews.author: Milton McCormick

customer_reviews.title: A very Good Hatchet and Made in the USA too!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought. My father liked mine so well I bought him one. Great quality well-balanced tool. Hatchet will need sharpening upon arrival. They seem to ship with a dulled edge. But a couple minutes with a file or stone fixes the edge. Once sharpened it holds the edge well. Perfect tool to have when felling with a chainsaw to drive wedges and cut small limbs.
customer_reviews.author: veneilijä

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Strong and holds up for a long time. I used for years.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Willis

customer_reviews.title: Cannot live without one.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned one fo these for 30 years and it has seen PLENTY of use. Not just for building. Over the years my hatchet has performed some serious tasks, including chopping out and chopping down trees. I recently broke the handle due to a bit too much abuse on my part, but easily fixed. I would recommend these to anyone who wants more than any old hammer and one with a bit of heft to it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fannell

customer_reviews.title: Well worth every penny...
customer_reviews.text: Solid and very high quality. I did have to put a real edge on it, but that was expected. I can slice paper with it and fall a small tree!
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: A framer's tool
customer_reviews.text: this rigging ax is made the same as it was thirty year's ago. I wonder if the new trade's men know what it is used for!
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: comes in handy
customer_reviews.text: i keep this in my truck as a handy tool. i like it
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: Multi purpose tool !
customer_reviews.text: It's a riggers axe very simple yet effective piece of equipment. I use it for framing and it holds up very well to the abuse. Handle is strong doesn't vibrate to bad. I even sharpened the axe tip and I use it to cut fire wood. Now that's a multi purpose tool !
customer_reviews.author: rajan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Framed with one in my younger years, Just had to have one
customer_reviews.author: Martin C Luningham

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on my girlfriends account, I'm a carpenter and have many Vaughan hammers but this disappointed me. When i got it it feels great like my other Vaughn's but the hatchet blade was way more dull than my hammer claws. We do a lot of concrete forms and i would love to split stakes but i have to take my grinder to a brand new hammer to sharpen it. These uses to be razor sharp from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good solid axe
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping...has worked out great. Extra length to handle provides more umph when chopping larger firewood and hammer side comes in hand driving stakes, breaking nuts open, etc.....
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Heavy hitter
customer_reviews.text: Heavy hitter and I like it, didnt come sharp but I know how to remedy that
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bachiller

product_meta.title: Vaughan RB 28-Ounce Rig Builders Hatchet, Hickory Handle for heavy construction, 17-Inch Long.
product_meta.description:
2472-9154 Features: -Polished striking head, crowned milled face. -Replacement handle (1341-7068). -3-1/2'' blade. -28 oz. -Truly professional tool designed for heavy construction. Product Type: -Hatchet. Handle: -Wood. Dimensions: -17'' wood handle. Overall Length - Top to Bottom: -7". Overall Width - Side to Side: -1.5". Overall Depth - Front to Back: -17.5". Overall Product Weight: -2.24 lbs.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
RB Professional Rig Builders Hatchet has fully a polished head. Extra large milled face with 3 1/2" blade. Select, flame-treated hickory handle. A truly professional tool designed for heavy construction.
